intro: Uncinia hamata, commonly known as the hooked hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, ribbed fruits that are dispersed by wind. Uncinia hamata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
